intro: Mammea veimauriensis, commonly known as the Veimaurien mammea, is a rare shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, orange-red flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
